GT.content: soon as there is law, law of partition (partage), law as partition (moira), soon as there is nomy—there’s economy (oikonomia) > exchange, circulation, return (retour); figure of circle, amortization
GT.linkedContent: soon as there is law, law of partition (partage), law as partition (moira), soon as there is nomy—there’s economy (oikonomia) > exchange, circulation, return (retour); figure of circle, amortization

GT.content: figure of circle essential to economics, gift must remain aneconomic
GT.linkedContent: figure of circle essential to economics, gift must remain aneconomic

GT.content: obsessing over circle encircling us, Heidegger [see OS] on circle, point, as vulgar time; time as circle: one of most powerful, ineluctable representations in history of metaphysics ——can’t exactly escape circle, it’s a feast for thinking, but gift as instant of effraction of circle
GT.linkedContent: obsessing over circle encircling us, Heidegger [see OS] on circle, point, as vulgar time; time as circle: one of most powerful, ineluctable representations in history of metaphysics ——can’t exactly escape circle, it’s a feast for thinking, but gift as instant of effraction of circle

GT.content: why desire to interrupt circulation of circle, why desire the gift?
GT.linkedContent: why desire to interrupt circulation of circle, why desire the gift?

GT.content: relation of gift to “present,” essential knot in interlace of this discourse [GT], in knot of Geflecht of which Heidegger says the circle is perhaps only one figure/particular case
GT.linkedContent: relation of gift to “present,” essential knot in interlace of this discourse [GT], in knot of Geflecht of which Heidegger says the circle is perhaps only one figure/particular case

GT.content: is madness the movement of the circle or its excess? besieges reason at its 2 borders (inside & outside)
GT.linkedContent: is madness the movement of the circle or its excess? besieges reason at its 2 borders (inside & outside)

R.content: turning of the question, double question, question of question, like being locked in a circular machine that does not work or turn just right [Olivia]
R.linkedContent: turning of the question, double question, question of question, like being locked in a circular machine that does not work or turn just right [Olivia]

R.content: democracy as the turning, the wheel, the sovereignty that gives the force of law, circularity, sphericity > either identity btwn origin/conclusion or by turns, in turn, each in turn
R.linkedContent: democracy as the turning, the wheel, the sovereignty that gives the force of law, circularity, sphericity > either identity btwn origin/conclusion or by turns, in turn, each in turn

R.content: Aristotle’s Prime Mover, the first desirable, gives a life that exceeds the life of a human, continuous, unending—for us, impossible
R.linkedContent: Aristotle’s Prime Mover, the first desirable, gives a life that exceeds the life of a human, continuous, unending—for us, impossible

R.content: energeia of this pure activity is “pleasure (hēdonē), circle of taking pleasure in oneself (jouissance de soi); a specular auto-affection that accords w/ thinking of thought
R.linkedContent: energeia of this pure activity is “pleasure (hēdonē), circle of taking pleasure in oneself (jouissance de soi); a specular auto-affection that accords w/ thinking of thought

H.content: always threatened by this dilemma: 1) when unconditional hospitality is circumscribed by economy of circle  (law, duty) [vs. ring?] 2) when unconditional hospitality dispenses w/ law
H.linkedContent: always threatened by this dilemma: 1) when unconditional hospitality is circumscribed by economy of circle (law, duty) [vs. ring?] 2) when unconditional hospitality dispenses w/ law

OOG.content: [quoted from “Form and Meaning”] no choice [undecidable] btwn 2 lines of thought but to reflect on circularity that makes one pass into the other, by repeating the circle, an elliptical change of site, producing a non-negative deficiency as ellipsis of form and meaning
OOG.linkedContent: [quoted from “Form and Meaning”] no choice [undecidable] btwn 2 lines of thought but to reflect on circularity that makes one pass into the other, by repeating the circle, an elliptical change of site, producing a non-negative deficiency as ellipsis of form and meaning

HERP.content: caught in ring of circle once questioning philosophy, engaged by Greek tongue > acc. Heidegger, obscurely, authoritatively, Greek tongue alone is logos
HERP.linkedContent: caught in ring of circle once questioning philosophy, engaged by Greek tongue > acc. Heidegger, obscurely, authoritatively, Greek tongue alone is logos

EM.content: reading of text Dasein is a hermeneutics > if one looks closely, phenomenological opposition “implicit/explicit” permits Heidegger to avoid vicious circle (posing question of Being on basis of ontological predetermination)
EM.linkedContent: reading of text Dasein is a hermeneutics > if one looks closely, phenomenological opposition “implicit/explicit” permits Heidegger to avoid vicious circle (posing question of Being on basis of ontological predetermination)

PAS.content: Blanchot: circle of law is this: must be a crossing for there to be a limit, uncrossable that in its desire, its call, has already crossed the line [appele à franchir]
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: circle of law is this: must be a crossing for there to be a limit, uncrossable that in its desire, its call, has already crossed the line [appele à franchir]

S.content: how else but by confirming it a priori and circularly can Heidegger question Dasein’s privilege (Vorrang) re: the question?
S.linkedContent: how else but by confirming it a priori and circularly can Heidegger question Dasein’s privilege (Vorrang) re: the question?

S.content: via Heidegger’s course on Schelling, spirit is only proper if it is close to itself, desire for gathering, a nostalgia, a Sehnsucht, where Sucht, etymologically, isn’t research but evil, evil inscribed in desire > evil as the desire to go out of oneself in order to return to oneself (motif, movement, trajectory of fire, not circle, of return)
S.linkedContent: via Heidegger’s course on Schelling, spirit is only proper if it is close to itself, desire for gathering, a nostalgia, a Sehnsucht, where Sucht, etymologically, isn’t research but evil, evil inscribed in desire > evil as the desire to go out of oneself in order to return to oneself (motif, movement, trajectory of fire, not circle, of return)

S.content: Heidegger: “in spirit there reigns the nostalgia for its own essence”
S.linkedContent: Heidegger: “in spirit there reigns the nostalgia for its own essence”

S.content: [re: Gespräch btwn Heidegger & Trakl] the circle via death, via decline, via West that returns to most originary not analogous to circles/revolutions in Marx and Hegel, so “circle, decline, West,” in Heidegger, are paleonyms, receive quotation marks to lead us elsewhere
S.linkedContent: [re: Gespräch btwn Heidegger & Trakl] the circle via death, via decline, via West that returns to most originary not analogous to circles/revolutions in Marx and Hegel, so “circle, decline, West,” in Heidegger, are paleonyms, receive quotation marks to lead us elsewhere

WM.content: dominant metaphor, major signified of ontotheleogy: circle of the heliotrope
WM.linkedContent: dominant metaphor, major signified of ontotheleogy: circle of the heliotrope

DS.content: Mallarmé: “all method is a fiction” > point de méthode—still a marching order (marche à suivre) > la dissémination dans le repli de l’hymen, pas de méthode pour elle > [no circle-path to first step]
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé: “all method is a fiction” > point de méthode—still a marching order (marche à suivre) > la dissémination dans le repli de l’hymen, pas de méthode pour elle > [no circle-path to first step]

POS.content: “closure of metaphysics” can’t have form of line, form in which philosophy recognizes itself, not a circle surrounding homogenous field, limit as various faults, fissures, marks, scars
POS.linkedContent: “closure of metaphysics” can’t have form of line, form in which philosophy recognizes itself, not a circle surrounding homogenous field, limit as various faults, fissures, marks, scars

POS.content: metaphysical concept of history: meaning developing itself in straight, circular line
POS.linkedContent: metaphysical concept of history: meaning developing itself in straight, circular line

OS.content: via Heidegger, Hegel’s jetzt as boundary (Grenze), ‘absolute this (das ‘absolute Dieses’); Aristotle’s nun as stigmē, oros, tode ti > both stress circularity (Kreislauf, sphaira)
OS.linkedContent: via Heidegger, Hegel’s jetzt as boundary (Grenze), ‘absolute this (das ‘absolute Dieses’); Aristotle’s nun as stigmē, oros, tode ti > both stress circularity (Kreislauf, sphaira)

OS.content: point & time thought in circularity together (Aufhebung, speculative negativity, only possible by means of infinite correlation or reflection) > time is spacing, space is time > thus for Aristotle, stigmē, punctuality, determines nowness (nun, jetzt)
OS.linkedContent: point & time thought in circularity together (Aufhebung, speculative negativity, only possible by means of infinite correlation or reflection) > time is spacing, space is time > thus for Aristotle, stigmē, punctuality, determines nowness (nun, jetzt)

OS.content: transition from parousia to absolute subjectivity does not disrupt Aristotelianism: prime mover, presence, desire, eros, “desire is desire of presence,” absolute subjectivity, circle, return to self, parousia as self-presence > prime mover, noēsis noēseōs, as subject
OS.linkedContent: transition from parousia to absolute subjectivity does not disrupt Aristotelianism: prime mover, presence, desire, eros, “desire is desire of presence,” absolute subjectivity, circle, return to self, parousia as self-presence > prime mover, noēsis noēseōs, as subject

OS.content: for Aristotle, circle is model of movement for time and grammē
OS.linkedContent: for Aristotle, circle is model of movement for time and grammē

OS.content: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)
OS.linkedContent: for Aristotle, the point gives to length its continuity and limit, an end and a beginning (arkhē kai teleutē); but ‘now’ is not to time what point is to line, because successive arrests does not give time (ne donne pas le temps); instead, now is neither time’s origin, end or limit (to the extent that it belongs to time) > instead, must conceive of gramme [French] not as line (by way of its parts or points) but as a line in act, by way of its extremities (ta eskhata)

OS.content: this would be a gramme that erases its tracing in a circle, removes limit of point
OS.linkedContent: this would be a gramme that erases its tracing in a circle, removes limit of point

OS.content: we go around in circles trying to erase this circle > [time, still, introduces the thought of trace, if even to excise it]
OS.linkedContent: we go around in circles trying to erase this circle > [time, still, introduces the thought of trace, if even to excise it]

P.content: the circle & the abyss: circle en abyme
P.linkedContent: the circle & the abyss: circle en abyme

P.content: Hegel’s ternary rhythm—what he calls a “ring”—encircles, links to other rings: in science of beautiful, mind presupposes, anticipates itself > philosophy of art: circle in circle of circles
P.linkedContent: Hegel’s ternary rhythm—what he calls a “ring”—encircles, links to other rings: in science of beautiful, mind presupposes, anticipates itself > philosophy of art: circle in circle of circles

P.content: art forms only one of the circles in the great circle of Geist, revenant (circle of art, circle of religion, circle of philosophy)
P.linkedContent: art forms only one of the circles in the great circle of Geist, revenant (circle of art, circle of religion, circle of philosophy)

P.content: is there an abyss in Hegel? (circle in a circle not necessarily abyssal) for there to be an abyss the smallest circle would have to inscribe in itself the figure of the largest
P.linkedContent: is there an abyss in Hegel? (circle in a circle not necessarily abyssal) for there to be an abyss the smallest circle would have to inscribe in itself the figure of the largest

P.content: metaphor of circle of circles, of training (Bildung) as philosophical encyclopedia
P.linkedContent: metaphor of circle of circles, of training (Bildung) as philosophical encyclopedia

P.content: lemmatic precipitation, anticipatory conceptualizing, recourse to metaphor of circle, circle of circles, metaphor of organic whole [re: Hegel & philosophy as work of art]
P.linkedContent: lemmatic precipitation, anticipatory conceptualizing, recourse to metaphor of circle, circle of circles, metaphor of organic whole [re: Hegel & philosophy as work of art]

P.content: if Hegel must begin w/ vulgar art, the circle of circles allows him to start anywhere > art already there > “no absolute beginning in science”
P.linkedContent: if Hegel must begin w/ vulgar art, the circle of circles allows him to start anywhere > art already there > “no absolute beginning in science”

P.content: Hegel’s circles, each part of whole, a “circle returning to itself,” keeps tie of solidarity w/ others, through fecund backward and forward movement (Rückwärts, Vorwärts) [idea of beauty in philosophical encyclopedia]
P.linkedContent: Hegel’s circles, each part of whole, a “circle returning to itself,” keeps tie of solidarity w/ others, through fecund backward and forward movement (Rückwärts, Vorwärts) [idea of beauty in philosophical encyclopedia]

P.content: in Hegel & Heidegger, an “it is necessary (il faut)” re: hermeneutic circle of art > must start w/ work of art, but how can you recognize it as art if you don’t already know what art is?: not a vicious circle, but an engagement of thought, circular feast, experience of limit, closure, resistance, humility > pas de cercle: le désir par cette répétition fidèle du cercle, d’accéder à l’encore infranchi, le désir d’un nouveau pas > lien sans liens, franchir le cercle sans s’affranchir de sa loi, pas sans pas
P.linkedContent: in Hegel & Heidegger, an “it is necessary (il faut)” re: hermeneutic circle of art > must start w/ work of art, but how can you recognize it as art if you don’t already know what art is?: not a vicious circle, but an engagement of thought, circular feast, experience of limit, closure, resistance, humility > pas de cercle: le désir par cette répétition fidèle du cercle, d’accéder à l’encore infranchi, le désir d’un nouveau pas > lien sans liens, franchir le cercle sans s’affranchir de sa loi, pas sans pas

P.content: all this talk of circles has drawn us toward the abyss
P.linkedContent: all this talk of circles has drawn us toward the abyss

P.content: third party (ein Drittes) regulates encirclement, art can play this role, a medium, can touch both edges > ambiguity of participation can’t exhaust it [what if this 3rd doesn’t rèleve?]
P.linkedContent: third party (ein Drittes) regulates encirclement, art can play this role, a medium, can touch both edges > ambiguity of participation can’t exhaust it [what if this 3rd doesn’t rèleve?]

P.content: art: domesticated in this history of truth, onto-encyclopedic economy, the machinery of the pose (Setzung/Entgegensetzung)
P.linkedContent: art: domesticated in this history of truth, onto-encyclopedic economy, the machinery of the pose (Setzung/Entgegensetzung)

ROP.content: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)
ROP.linkedContent: divisibility of letter, truth w/out truth of deconstruction, distinguished both from das geistige Band [Hegel], & Heideggerian Versammlung > divisibility of letter undoes link of debt, symbolic, name of father (motifs qui lien et se lient au triangle ou au cercle de la réappropriation)

FS.content: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]
FS.linkedContent: God imprints secondarity on every navigation of the human: 1) passage of deferred reciprocity btwn reading & writing? 2) absolute witness who’s already read what you will write: third party as transparency of meaning? [circular logos]

TB.content: classic circle always begins to turn once one asks about origin of languages/society
TB.linkedContent: classic circle always begins to turn once one asks about origin of languages/society

PIO.content: racism is an invention of the other, one that excludes it, tightening circle of same
PIO.linkedContent: racism is an invention of the other, one that excludes it, tightening circle of same

RM.content: Geflecht, interlacing, in Der Weg zur Sprache, interlaces Sprache and Weg: a binding-unbinding interlacing (entrelacement liant-déliant) (entbindende Binde)
RM.linkedContent: Geflecht, interlacing, in Der Weg zur Sprache, interlaces Sprache and Weg: a binding-unbinding interlacing (entrelacement liant-déliant) (entbindende Binde)

RM.content: a circle that is not a vicious circle, yet still interlaced in advance > Sprache and Weg are “already in advance of us (uns stets schon voraus)”
RM.linkedContent: a circle that is not a vicious circle, yet still interlaced in advance > Sprache and Weg are “already in advance of us (uns stets schon voraus)”

AFR.content: Condillac’s identical proposition as powerful circle, finality of the same, circle of identity, self-evidence [brings whole to part] [but how can this circle close if whole is different from part?]
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s identical proposition as powerful circle, finality of the same, circle of identity, self-evidence [brings whole to part] [but how can this circle close if whole is different from part?]

AFR.content: reference to Rousseau’s objection to Condillac in 2nd Discourse: Rousseau denounces [turns of Condillac’s] circle only to step into it more quickly
AFR.linkedContent: reference to Rousseau’s objection to Condillac in 2nd Discourse: Rousseau denounces [turns of Condillac’s] circle only to step into it more quickly

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig, Cohen] system cannot be given, forbids or reappropriates the gift in advance (in a circular manner) > most generous gift: give to think beyond system
IW.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig, Cohen] system cannot be given, forbids or reappropriates the gift in advance (in a circular manner) > most generous gift: give to think beyond system

D.content: splayed square, triangle open on 4th side, loosens obsidionality of triangle and circle, whose ternary rhythm (Trinity, Oedipus, Dialectics) governs metaphysics
D.linkedContent: splayed square, triangle open on 4th side, loosens obsidionality of triangle and circle, whose ternary rhythm (Trinity, Oedipus, Dialectics) governs metaphysics

FV.content: circulation, always circulation of truth: toward truth, cause & effect of circle, causa sui, proper course (trajet) and destiny of letter > truth as cause (Ursache)
FV.linkedContent: circulation, always circulation of truth: toward truth, cause & effect of circle, causa sui, proper course (trajet) and destiny of letter > truth as cause (Ursache)
